snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio, the tallest mayor in New York’s modern history, is discovering that bigness can also be a burden, requiring a host of ergonomic adjustments and feats of stagecraft in City Hall.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio, tallest mayor in New York's modern history at 6 feet 5 and seven-eighths inches, is discovering that bigness can also be a burden; his height has required a host of ergonomic adjustments and feats of stagecraft in City Hall.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio, the tallest mayor in New York’s modern history, is discovering that bigness can also be a burden, requiring a host of ergonomic adjustments and feats of stagecraft in City Hall.

headline.main: A Mayor Most Everybody Looks Up To, Even When He Slouches
